channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Nearly 4,000 NASA employees opt to leave agency through deferred resignation program
item.description: The employees who have chosen to leave the agency amount to about 20% of NASA's workforce.
item.content:encoded:
The employees who have chosen to leave the agency amount to about 20% of NASA's workforce.

(Image credit: John Raoux)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Israel's military says aid airdrops will begin in Gaza as hunger grows
item.description: Israel's military said the airdrops would begin Saturday night in Gaza, after mounting accounts of starvation-related deaths. Israeli officials also said humanitarian corridors will be established.
item.content:encoded:
Israel's military said the airdrops would begin Saturday night in Gaza, after mounting accounts of starvation-related deaths. Israeli officials also said humanitarian corridors will be established.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What's at stake with the European Union-U.S. trading partnership if a tariff deal isn't reached
item.description: As the deadline for the start of 30 percent tariffs on the EU, Cecilia Malmstrom, former European Commissioner for Trade, explains the scope and scale of the EU-US trading partnership and what's at stake if a deal isn't reached.
item.content:encoded: As the deadline for the start of 30 percent tariffs on the EU, Cecilia Malmstrom, former European Commissioner for Trade, explains the scope and scale of the EU-US trading partnership and what's at stake if a deal isn't reached.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Taiwanese political gridlock endures as China-friendly party survives recall vote
item.description: A months-long recall effort to oust lawmakers considered pro-Chinese has failed in the self-governing island's legislature.
item.content:encoded:
A months-long recall effort to oust lawmakers considered pro-Chinese has failed in the self-governing island's legislature.

(Image credit: Jan Camenzind Broomby for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jan Camenzind Broomby

item.title: 'Scotland is already great.' Protesters troll Trump on his golfing trip
item.description: The U.S. president is spending a long weekend in his late mother's birth country of Scotland. There, he's been confronted by protesters waving photos of Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. president is spending a long weekend in his late mother's birth country of Scotland. There, he's been confronted by protesters waving photos of Jeffrey Epstein.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab

item.title: Southwest aircraft takes a dive to avoid midair collision
item.description: The Southwest Boeing 737 dropped almost 500 feet to avoid another aircraft.
item.content:encoded:
The Southwest Boeing 737 dropped almost 500 feet to avoid another aircraft.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Remembering David Nabarro: 'a great champion of global health and health equity'
item.description: That's how the head of the World Health Organization paid tribute to Nabarro's lifelong public health leadership. A physician, Nabarro was a leading voice in the effort to quash the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.content:encoded:
That's how the head of the World Health Organization paid tribute to Nabarro's lifelong public health leadership. A physician, Nabarro was a leading voice in the effort to quash the COVID-19 pandemic.

(Image credit: Victoria Jones via Pool)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: PEPFAR escaped the rescission ax. But where does it stand?
item.description: Founded by George W. Bush, the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief was taken out of the list of agencies that lost previously pledged funds. But its future is far from certain.
item.content:encoded:
Founded by George W. Bush, the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief was taken out of the list of agencies that lost previously pledged funds. But its future is far from certain.

(Image credit: Ben de la Cruz/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Get ready, Brazil. The 'good mosquitoes' are coming
item.description: Scientists are driving around in white Chevys, releasing thousands of specially engineered mosquitoes from tubes — part of a pioneering project to reduce the spread of dengue, a terrible disease.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists are driving around in white Chevys, releasing thousands of specially engineered mosquitoes from tubes — part of a pioneering project to reduce the spread of dengue, a terrible disease.

(Image credit: Ian Cheibub for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Even megastars like Venus Williams get the health insurance blues
item.description: In the U.S., as nowhere else, health insurance and employment are deeply connected. And that means confusion can snare even elite athletes.
item.content:encoded:
In the U.S., as nowhere else, health insurance and employment are deeply connected. And that means confusion can snare even elite athletes.

(Image credit: Scott Taetsch)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin
